caption.p: Annual extreme population changes of English Lepidoptera and birds. Upper panels: proportion of Lepidoptera (( a); butterflies and macro-moths) and bird species ( b) experiencing a population explosion (upwards bars) or crash (downwards bars). Asterisks denote significance of consensus years (* p < 0.05; *** p < 0.0001; Bonferroni-corrected for multiple-year testing); numbers at the top of the plots represent the number of species included in that year. Lower panels: relationships within ( c) and between ( d) higher taxonomic groups are significant ( p ≤ 0.03). Each filled circle represents one year. ‘Net population explosions’ represents the difference in numbers of species showing population explosions and crashes in a given year (e.g. if there are five species with an explosion and 15 with a crash in the same year, that year scores −10).
